review_preview: We were a party of 7 in Madrid for business and got to the restaurant just as it was opening and got lucky to score a table. Reservations are pretty much required because this place is that popular with locals and tourists alike. Best Sangria...
review_full: We were a party of 7 in Madrid for business and got to the restaurant just as it was opening and got lucky to score a table. Reservations are pretty much required because this place is that popular with locals and tourists alike.  Best Sangria we had while in Madrid and it come in three varieties of varying sweetness, red, white and pink. The menu consists on fresh imaginative twists on tapas and Spanish classic dishes.  We tried almost everything and loved it all. Highlights were the Octopus, Burrata and Ribs but honestly all of it was amazing. Staff was efficient, friendly and knowledgeable. Music and decoration were amazing in my opinion.  If you are in Madrid and you can get a reservation here you won’t be disappointed.

title_review: Creative Menu. Not as radical as Valle-Inclan himself
review_preview: Named after Ramón María del Valle-Inclán, the radical Galician dramatist who subverted the traditionalism of the Spanish theatrical establishment of the 20th century----there was nothing radical about the place when I visited for lunch. I suspect the ambiance changes greatly at night. However, the enthusiasm...
review_full: Named after Ramón María del Valle-Inclán, the radical Galician dramatist who subverted the traditionalism of the Spanish theatrical establishment of the 20th century----there was nothing radical about the place when I visited for lunch. I suspect the ambiance changes greatly at night. However, the enthusiasm of the staff was contagious and the menu was varied, creative and well priced. I enjoyed the large portions of mushroom risotto and the cod in a coconut milk vegetable sauce. Music, other than a top forty soundtrack, would have added to the atmosphere. Overall a good experience.

Javier came over a couple of minutes after each tapa came out and asked how we liked it. What great service. Great atmosphere, music playing, people laughing at the bar. The title is the farewell shot he gave us of a cosmo as we left the restaurant. If you don't eat here you are missing out. Should be ranked much higher !!!

It has a big variety of food options, which are customized for any tupe of diet. What me and my friend tried was the Veggie Bagel, which was amazing and full of different flavors ( the wild mushrooms in combination with the caramelized onion was fenomenal. ) and the Mixed Berries Pancakes. They were rich in wild berries and softly combined with jam and ice cream.  Moreover, whichever you order from the menu will probably be amazing, but this is my personal recommendation. Hope you liked it as much as we did. Enjoy!

review_preview: Our family is in Madrid for a few days, visiting one of our daughters who is studying in Spain this semester.  Two days ago, the rest of the family crashed early, so she and I decided to grab some dinner and she found Taberna Mas...
review_full: Our family is in Madrid for a few days, visiting one of our daughters who is studying in Spain this semester. Two days ago, the rest of the family crashed early, so she and I decided to grab some dinner and she found Taberna Mas Al Sur on line. Not far from where we were staying, we decided to take a chance and walked over for dinner. We were blown away! So naturally, two nights later when all five of us were on our last night in Madrid, I suggested that we return. So glad we did, We started off with drinks, as it's a small restaurant and we had to wait for a table. Their bartenders are exceptional. I revisited the Mojito I had a couple days earlier and was delighted that it was just as good. Wife and daughter had tasty sangria and our sons had margaritas which were both delicious and aesthetically pleasing.  After a short wait, we were seated at a cozy table and decided to order everything to share. We stopped short of ordering one of everything, but weren't far off. We had all the usual tapas fare (jamon, croquettes, omelette, quiche) and also had entrees which we all sampled (shrimp in garlic, pork, brochetas de salmon). Nothing on the table was short of amazing. We finished off with cheesecake and carrot cake. At the end of the meal, our 24 year old son exclaimed that this was, by far, the best meal he had ever enjoyed. I'm right there with him. The craziest thing about the evening was that the tab for all five of us, including two drinks each AND a pitcher of sangria, was under 108 Euros for a dinner that left us wanting nothing more. I honestly don't know how these guys do it! If you're in Madrid, do yourself a favor and stop at al Sur for dinner. The only challenge you'll have all night is deciding what to order.

review_preview: I don't even know where to begin because I loved this place so much (and went there three times during my stay in Madrid as a conséquence...)First, the place itself is lovely: quotations from Valle-Inclán on various walls, books "flying" on the ceiling, bloody...
review_full: I don't even know where to begin because I loved this place so much (and went there three times during my stay in Madrid as a conséquence...) First, the place itself is lovely: quotations from Valle-Inclán on various walls, books "flying" on the ceiling, bloody "brutal bar" written at the entrance, and there is an overall cozy feeling to it (the dim Light, probably :).  Second, the staff is super friendly, efficient and available. Valentina made us feel welcome the minute we stepped in. All our questions were met with nice answers and smiles.  Third, the food is simply wonderful! We tried different tapas and the flavours were all interesting. There is definitely a lot of work and creativity behind the food, it is really one of a kind. We tried the gazpacho (unique! I have tasted many gazpachos and this one is second to none), the burrata (very generous and tasty), the patatas (perfectly cooked), etc. The tapa that made me crazy was the bacon. The way they serve it is really creative (I don't want to spoil the surprise!) and it's just incredible good (Oh the way it goes with the Apple cream... It's like they complement each other).  I haven't mentioned it but each time the bill was ridiculously low for the quality of the food...

review_full: This place is on a hidden side street from Plaza Del Sol towards Huerta neighborhood. It was an accidental discovery after the restaurant we wanted to go was closed but one that we were glad we made. Staff were very friendly, the food was delicious and the prices reasonable. We tried octopus, pork, chicken, croquets. One thing that is different about the food is that unlike typical Spanish tapas, theirs use a lot of sauce, which reminded me of French cuisine. The decor is chic and there is a botanical garden patio enclosed by glass wall.  I recommend it.

review_preview: It was the last night in Madrid with our son who is studying there.  We did not to waste it on a bad meal, and it was Good Friday, so may places were closed.  We picked this due to the proximity to a train station...
review_full: It was the last night in Madrid with our son who is studying there. We did not to waste it on a bad meal, and it was Good Friday, so may places were closed. We picked this due to the proximity to a train station and the reviews and we were not disappointed. Although our reservations were mixed up, we were seated at the bar, and we could have waited, but decided to eat there, which is very comfortable. The food was very good, as was the service and the gin and tonics. The squid was fabulous, the rissoto was very good. The croquetas were just ok, but my son loved them. The steak and potatoes were very good (entree). One daquari, 3 glasses of wine, 2 gin and tonics, 2 entrees and 5 tapas was 66E. What a deal. Service was fantastic although the place was mobbed. Go.

review_preview: We arrived in Madrid this afternoon and I’d already researched restaurants around our hotel, The Steakburger was directly opposite to our hotel and I am so glad we chose it. We ordered the Steakburger Nachos which were amazing with enough toppings for both of us,...
review_full: We arrived in Madrid this afternoon and I’d already researched restaurants around our hotel, The Steakburger was directly opposite to our hotel and I am so glad we chose it. We ordered the Steakburger Nachos which were amazing with enough toppings for both of us, then we both ordered the La Suzia burger, we were not expecting what we got! The burger came out with a skillet of melted cheese which was then poured on top of our burgers, this was the most amazing burger we have eaten for a long time! You get to choose between beef and ox burger, how it is cooked, the size from 4 different sizes, the bread, and the sides. The service in the restaurant was really good, quick service for brilliant food! Would recommend to anyone visiting Madrid!

title_review: Fantastic restaurant and great value for money
review_preview: This is great little restaurant run by a team of young and enthusiastic hosts, who pay attention to their guests and look after every detail. We went one evening, and liked it so much that were back for our final meal before we left Madrid....
review_full: This is great little restaurant run by a team of young and enthusiastic hosts, who pay attention to their guests and look after every detail. We went one evening, and liked it so much that were back for our final meal before we left Madrid. For lunch, the Menu del Dia offers excellent dishes at a great price, less than 10 Euros for three courses and a drink. The a la carte menu has some of the familiar dishes, cooked beautifully, and some really unusual options - the Mediterranean salad, and the Solomillo with Musacatel and Grapes were particularly special. Excellent Sangria, with a hint of cinnamon, and the freshest lemonade, which our daughter loved. Full of locals, and with a friendly, buzzy atmosphere. Jonny was the perfect host, and even ran out in the rain to help us get our bags into our taxi. Thanks for a great experience; highly recommended.

Cocktails were great and all beer and food was reasonably priced (Under 100 Euros for four eating and drinking). Food was delicious, fresh, and creative. I will definitely be returning in the future!

review_preview: Yesterday we had eaten an amazing meal at Rosi La Loca (see my very long Trip Advisor review) and were encouraged by the manager Alejandro to try its sister restaurant, InClan Brutal Bar, tonight.   The food was equally good, and although we are tourists who...
review_full: Yesterday we had eaten an amazing meal at Rosi La Loca (see my very long Trip Advisor review) and were encouraged by the manager Alejandro to try its sister restaurant, InClan Brutal Bar, tonight. The food was equally good, and although we are tourists who had not eaten there before, we were treated like VIPs by the Manager Francesco and his terrific staff. When I say “sister restaurant”- there is a literal meaning, as the hostess for InClan Brutal Bar, Helena, is the sister of the hostess for Rosi La Loca, Eva, who had treated us so marvelously last night. Helena is a blonde and Eva is a brunette, but they are equal in warmth and charm - and Helena did a great job of answering all of our menu questions and recommending sumptuous items off of the menu. Our waitress, Julia, was also attentive and very helpful. We ordered amazing tapas appetizers that included burrata infused with pesto and tomato emulsion; hummus with chips and delicious BRUTAL potato wedges with an amazing aoli sauce. Then we moved on to tenderloins of pork, marinated octopus tentacle and the incredible tataki tuna. Everything was just delicious, and the service was amazing.  The wine and sangria were also delicious. The incredible thing about this restaurant, like Rosi La Loca, is that the prices are extremely reasonable and the staff is responsive and extremely helpful. We had a great meal in a welcoming environment.  We would give this restaurant, along with Rosi La Loca, our highest ratings. We would absolutely suggest both as can’t miss favorites for any visit to Madrid, but would suggest you not eat at them in consecutive nights, only because of the similarity of the food. But to be clear, it was similarly delicious! We were glad we got to both before heading home! Thanks to Francesco, Helena and Julia! You made our evening at InClan Brutal Bar memorable!  PS - Be sure to make a reservation - both places were packed and there was a line waiting outside when we left.

review_preview: We visited on Christmas Day as a family of 5 and had a lovely time at Inclán Brutal Bar. We started with a jug of sangria and a number of tapas, including the octopus and veal. With some big eaters in the family, we also...
review_full: We visited on Christmas Day as a family of 5 and had a lovely time at Inclán Brutal Bar. We started with a jug of sangria and a number of tapas, including the octopus and veal. With some big eaters in the family, we also ordered the chicken and seafood paella for 2, which was an incredible amount of food. To finish, we had the rice pudding mousse with a mango core. It was absolutely delicious, and I wish I had ordered 10 more. However, the highlight of our evening wasn’t just the food, but our service. George and his colleagues were very accommodating, friendly, and professional. They made our Christmas so lovely and did everything with a smile. I recommend everyone take time to visit Inclan when in Madrid.

review_preview: I was in Madrid for 6 months (as exchange student). Since I'm a person who loves good food, I ate in several restaurants in Madrid. Inclan was the best of all of them. The Burrata with pesto injection is just delicious. The tuna tataki is...
review_full: I was in Madrid for 6 months (as exchange student). Since I'm a person who loves good food, I ate in several restaurants in Madrid. Inclan was the best of all of them. The Burrata with pesto injection is just delicious. The tuna tataki is the best fish, I've ever had. Even the typical spanish dishes (as croquetas or tortilla) are just better here. There's always something special with the food. And also the meat (especially the Txuleton) is nice and perfectly medium. And the food itself is always served in a fancy way and every plate is a little piece of art. I also can recommend the "Menu del día". And the best thing: it is also not very expensive. I was here with all my guest who visited me in Madrid, and everybody fell in love with this place.

They treat you so kindly here, from the very beginning everyone was friendly and more so over time. They genuinely care about their customers here. Even on the most busy and frustrating days they've put on a brave face and a smile. The burritos are such great value for money, especially considering how tasty they are, getting more ingredients doesn't cost extra so go ahead and get it all; you'll end up with a massive burrito! Spain isn't known for its spiciness, but here you'll be able to find some proper spice; I hope you can handle it! I would say this place is suitable for all ages and groups as well, and it works really well for larger groups as you can get big containers of beer to serve yourselves at your table.  I want to go out of my way to say thank you for the great service to: Adrian, Gala, Iciar and Jonathan (Hopefully I spelt them all right!)

review_preview: On a visit to Madrid, we were delighted to find Cherry Pecas to satiate our craving for mojitos and tacos. You order at the counter, which is nice since it's quicker than table service usually (great when dining with a kid). My father gets quesadillas...
review_full: On a visit to Madrid, we were delighted to find Cherry Pecas to satiate our craving for mojitos and tacos. You order at the counter, which is nice since it's quicker than table service usually (great when dining with a kid). My father gets quesadillas the world over and loved the one they served. My husband and I each loved our tacos. The vibe was lively, bright, but relaxing. They were great about helping us choose from the menu and so helpful to bring our drinks to the table. The drinks are served in handled jars with aluminum foil over top and straws peeking through. I loved that so much! And the flavors were fresh and the kind of thing you want more of. I became an instant fan and love this place. Highly recommended for food, atmosphere, and staff friendliness.

The food is amazing and there are so many options of what to get, I never get the exact same thing twice. The workers are so friendly and engage in small talk with me even though my spanish is not the greatest. They have even remembered me when I came into the restaurant with my family. The value of the food is incredible, and as a college student, it's nice paying only 7 euros for a burrito. Incredible service all around.

review_preview: From the first moment when you walk in, and you are warmly greeted, to the moment you leave feeling like a friend or family member, this experience is one to remember.  We didn't have reservations, on a Saturday evening at 9pm (pretty silly on our...
review_full: From the first moment when you walk in, and you are warmly greeted, to the moment you leave feeling like a friend or family member, this experience is one to remember. We didn't have reservations, on a Saturday evening at 9pm (pretty silly on our behalf) but the owner almost seemed apologetic that we had to wait to be seated. Within 2 minutes of entering, we had a small soup to warm us and whet our appetite. Drinks ordered, and olives came next. Remember, this is all before we leave bar area. The ambiance is lovely, the staff really attentive and friendly. We ordered some tapas to start, manchego cheese, Chorizo, Jamon and migas, all were wonderful. I specifically want to mention the Chorizo infierno as it was amazing. For main course, we shared Entrecote grilled on charcoal. Possibly one of the best I have had in my 43 years. If a better all round restaurant exists in Madrid, I'd love to know. It's only situated about 100metres from the royal palace. Don't be silly like us, make a booking ( you might be able to get seated in the cellar!) I highly recommend this place. The owner,and our waitress Noria deserve special mention.

title_review: Perfect evening from start to finish

review_full: Whilst enjoying a short city break to Madrid we booked this restaurant on a whim having walked past it during the day. I am so glad we decided to as we had a perfect evening.  The restaurant is cosy with a great atmosphere and friendly staff. We were sat downstairs in the arches or cellar, not sure what to call it, but I would highly recommend booking a table in this part of the restaurant as it was beautiful.  Our waitress Jazmin was knowledgeable and attentive providing us with great recommendations. They brought us a soup to start our meal which was a nice touch. We went on to order a tapas platter and seafood paella. The tapas of meats and cheese came with bread the most delicious olive oil we have both ever had. We shared a paella which came with mussels and king prawns. The paella was tasty and there was plenty of it. Despite being full we shared some desserts which again were delicious.  If I return to Madrid I will certainly make sure I return to La Mi Venta. Highly recommended and great value for money.

title_review: Real Madrid Romance in a cave dining space!
review_preview: After a long day walking and sight seeing we were looking for something local and romantic for our first “date night” on our honeymoon. How lucky were we to find La Mi Venta. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with friendliness, served soup...
review_full: After a long day walking and sight seeing we were looking for something local and romantic for our first “date night” on our honeymoon. How lucky were we to find La Mi Venta. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with friendliness, served soup and tapas at the bar while we waited for the perfect table. Owner Ivan wanted this to be the perfect honeymoon experience. Our eyes were wide and our mouths salivating as we were seated in the downstairs “cave” where Ivan’s father started it all by hanging the famous hams. And what Ham it is! Delicious. Followed by the most incredible squid and then, the t bone, oh the t bone. Topped off with (unknown to our hosts) our favourite desert combination of caramel and custard! Ramone, our delightful waiter got every recommendation perfect, including the white bottle of wine I had to wash it wall down!! This was just the most perfect way to experience local Madrid dining, under the watch of the palace above and via the cobblestone laneway home. 10/10!!

title_review: Agree with the last review - authentic and fabulous!
review_preview: We had a beautiful meal here this weekend during a short stay in Madrid following some recommendations.  Wow.  So glad we did. A wonderful experience from ‘greeting ‘til goodbye’ - definitely not a fast-food nor rushed experience.We were warmly greeted by the owner, the...
review_full: We had a beautiful meal here this weekend during a short stay in Madrid following some recommendations. Wow. So glad we did. A wonderful experience from ‘greeting ‘til goodbye’ - definitely not a fast-food nor rushed experience. We were warmly greeted by the owner, the son of the founder, who proudly explained the history of the restaurant and what they do. He was passionate about what they did, introduced me to our waiter and then we were taken to a wonderful table downstairs in a lovely warm and cozy room. We were immediately served a boiling hot broth that was made using the local jamon - lovely. Great menu that was brilliantly explained and was packed full of authentic Spanish fayre - from tapas for one or to share, thru to local steaks and vegetables. We had some chorizo and local tomatoes in oil and garlic - simple but so tasty. We then both decided to have the hake with vegetables. Again, simple but packed full of flavour and also freshly hot. We, sadly, had no room for dessert but what we saw looked great. The wine we had, a fabulous Priorat, was great and of brilliant value.  Lovely coffee to finish and then an extremely warm ‘thanks and goodbye’ from the waiter and owner.  Food and service was excellent - please do give this place a go. We are so glad we did!

title_review: I honestly got a little angry
review_preview: I honestly got a little angry reading some other American reviewer’s “average steakhouse” comments because, frankly, if all you want to do is eat steak when you travel to Spain, don’t travel to Spain. Myself, I passed this place while walking to the Sabatini Garden...
review_full: I honestly got a little angry reading some other American reviewer’s “average steakhouse” comments because, frankly, if all you want to do is eat steak when you travel to Spain, don’t travel to Spain. Myself, I passed this place while walking to the Sabatini Garden this afternoon and purposely headed back here just before siesta to enjoy authentic Spanish food and beer while sitting at a little table on the street. My waiter, Victor, was attentive but not in a way which made me think he was just trying to turn over a table quickly- he seemed to be truly invested in my experience. I asked what kind of beer they had, to which he responded “solo uno” and I gladly ordered it along with some water and the Anchoas Especiales del Cantábrico (00) 6 Filetes con tomate Especiado con Aceite de Oliva y Piparras (anchovies with spiced tomato, olive oil, & peppers). It was phenomenal! The salt of the fish, the slight heat of the peppers, the tang of the tomatoes, and olive oil blended wonderfully as they crossed my tastebuds, and the beer was crisp and refreshing (not until a Pilsner) without the skunk smell that I find many Spanish beers have. After I’d finished and asked for my check, Victor brought me a complimentary liquor for me to taste, and it was the perfect end to a delightful pre-siesta meal. If you truly appreciate food and culture, this place will not disappoint.

review_preview: After a week in Spain eating traditional Spanish dishes every single meal, we were pretty much tapa'd out. With all the bread and potatoes that came with every single dish, I was surprised I still fit into the clothes I brought haha. We were on...
review_full: After a week in Spain eating traditional Spanish dishes every single meal, we were pretty much tapa'd out. With all the bread and potatoes that came with every single dish, I was surprised I still fit into the clothes I brought haha. We were on the hunt for something different, but still local.  I came across InClan Brutal and was intrigued by the pictures of the food. It totally reminded me of those trendy restaurants back in Chicago that tried to separate itself from the competition with original concepts and creativity. Spring rolls that look like cigars? Hand torching strips of bacon hanging from a line? Injecting burrata with pesto sauce? They looked unique but still delicious. There was a chance that it was all a gimmick, but InClan was worth a shot.  I luckily snagged a last minute reservation for 2 on The Fork. It was located along a street full of tapas restaurants right off of Puerta del Sol. We still haven't gotten used to the European standards of dinner time so it was completely empty at 6:30 PM, but jam packed by the time we left at 8. Drinks: Their red and white sangrias were great. I usually find traditional sangria to be too sweet and heavy, so I liked that their sangria was more of a blend of different elements. It was sweet enough but still very light and had a refreshing carbonation from the soda. Food: After 2 weeks of eating out, we were trying to control ourselves, but we just couldn't help but order everything off the menu since it all sounded so good.  Burrata injected with pesto - This is one of those dishes that was made for the gram. They brought out a ball of soft and creamy burrata cheese, and then proceeded to inject it with a flavor burst of pesto sauce. Not only did it look pretty, but it tasted great. That soft and creamy cheese mixed perfectly with the garlicky pesto, and it was the perfect spread for the bread they gave. It was one of the more expensive tapas, but totally worth it.  Potato wedges with brutal sauce - I vowed to not each potatoes for the rest of the trip after stuffing ourselves with potatoes five ways at Alhambra the night before, but I just couldn't resist after seeing pictures of the creamy brutal sauce. It was basically a bowl of fried potato wedges just covered in a tasty chipotle mayo sauce. The sauce was creamier and smokier with less tang than your typical bravas sauce. No regrets.  Iberian pork sirloin with cheese sauce, sweet potato chips, and apple compote - After going hard with pretty much 4 appetizers, this was the only entree we ordered. Portion-wise we were happy it wasn't so huge that it put us over the top. This dish had an upscale type of presentation with a rustic wooden platter, perfectly assembled stacks of pork and sweet potato, and then mini dollops of apple compote along the edge. The pork was tender and flavorful and the sweet potato chips were light and crispy. We've become wary of the cheese in Spain because they seemed to love the really strong roquefort/gorgonzola/goat cheeses, which we found it really overwhelming. In this case though, this cheese sauce was very mild and had only a tolerable hint of that strong flavor. Overall it had a nice sweet and savory flavor contrast throughout.  Undercooked potato omelette with black truffle pate - I like egg and potatoes, but every Spanish omelette I've had so far was a little bland and in need of seasoning. I was intrigued by InClan's version because I love runny yolks, and their undercooked version was right up my alley. On top of that, even though you couldn't see it, the black truffle was strong enough to infiltrate every bite. Great truffle flavor without being too overwhelming. Ham croquettes - We originally didn't even order these since we already got the potato wedges, but after hearing a lady at the table next to us describe them as the best croquettes she's ever had, there's no way I could've resisted. She was right. They were filled with mostly bechamel sauce and ham instead of the usual 95% mashed potato filler. Hot and crispy on the outside, creamy and cheesy on the inside...the perfect croquette. Overall, InClan Brutal was fantastic. The food was creative, delicious, and surprisingly filling. Every dish was pretty much a home run. The most shocking part was the value. I couldn't believe how cheap our bill was, given how amazed we were by our dinner. Definitely one of the highlight meals of our trip.

review_full: We stumbled across this little place after a tour of the palace. We were only in Madrid for three nights, yet managed to visit La Mi Venta on three separate occasions. On each visit the service was fantastic and the food quite simply delicious. I note one previous comment about this restaurant being situated within a "very quiet area" - Not quite the case in my opinion. Yes, the street itself is quiet; alas if you dine Al Fresco then you will have to contend with a very busy road that is but 25 metres away (almost unavoidable in Madrid). Asides from the aforementioned, the restaurant is situated within a lovely area and is well worth visiting. You can be assured of good quality food and beverages at a very reasonable price.

Aitor and Ramses were our waiters and they were very attentive and friendly. Highly recommended.

review_preview: Mildly jet lagged on our first day in Madrid from the USA after a full afternoon of touring the royal palace, Cathedral Almudena, and a visit to the Temple of Debod at sunset, we found this amazing gem close by the Palace! Didier, Head waiter,...
review_full: Mildly jet lagged on our first day in Madrid from the USA after a full afternoon of touring the royal palace, Cathedral Almudena, and a visit to the Temple of Debod at sunset, we found this amazing gem close by the Palace! Didier, Head waiter, and Jazmin, our sweet waitress, warmly welcomed us. We were treated to a delicious complimentary cup of bone broth de jamon, pan served with the finest olive oil. Jazmin made wonderful recommendations to help us enjoy a truly cultural Spanish dinner, including jamon croquettes, ceviche salad, Iberico jamon with potatoes and pepper, paella, sangria, and vino! Toffee dessert and mango sopa dessert along with a complimentary liquor. The ambiance of the restaurant was quite enchanting and the whole experience was the perfect ending to our first day in Madrid, España! Highly recommend adding this restaurant to your itinerary! Gracias, Didier y Jazmin!

title_review: The best food I ate in Europe
review_preview: I went to Europe for two weeks and visited five countries, and this is the place I remember. I found it on trip advisor while walking around solo, and I was starving. I stopped in for a quick bite, and absolutely EVERYTHING was INCREDIBLE. The...
review_full: I went to Europe for two weeks and visited five countries, and this is the place I remember. I found it on trip advisor while walking around solo, and I was starving. I stopped in for a quick bite, and absolutely EVERYTHING was INCREDIBLE. The staff was so friendly (remember I was eating alone), and I ordered Gazpacho, potato fries, and hummus along with a drink. I cannot explain in words how grateful I was for a good meal. I have a sensitive stomach and I'm EXTREMELY picky. To top it off, I was lost upon exiting and a very kind waitress walked me outside to show me how to find the metro. I LOOOOOOOOOOVED this place.

title_review: Modern, quirky tapas and a welcoming atmosphere
review_preview: We were introduced to this restaurant during a food tour (Spanish Tapas Madrid) and enjoyed the food and atmosphere so much we went back the following night to try more items from the menu.  On both occasions we were impressed by the friendliness and warmth...
review_full: We were introduced to this restaurant during a food tour (Spanish Tapas Madrid) and enjoyed the food and atmosphere so much we went back the following night to try more items from the menu. On both occasions we were impressed by the friendliness and warmth of the staff, and although we speak no Spanish we felt very welcome (special thanks to Frederic who looked after us at the bar).  We loved the food, every dish is thoughtfully presented - some with little tricks for your senses or an element of theatrics - but the flavours are definitely not sacrificed for the sake of appearances. Everything is extremely well-priced, very reasonable and the menu is constructed in such as way that it is easy to select a range of sharing dishes to test your appetite and then go back for more if you find you still have room.  We loved it and have since recommended it to several colleagues, and another tour guide.

title_review: An unplanned visit turned out to be extremely satisfactory
review_preview: 參觀皇宮後經過這家餐廳時剛好是午飯時間，看過網評後便決定一試。進餐的地方在地牢，很有歷史感和品味，客人看來都很上流。雖然他們有提供了英文菜單，但是菜式都不太熟悉，很高興侍應Didier很快便過來講解和協助，最後便選了炭烤烏賊作主菜，甜點是蘋果批，配酒就由Didier決定。食物的味道非常出色，加上Didier的熱情的招待，這個午餐實在非常稱心愉快。餐湯和dessert wine是餐廳免費送上的，很貼心。 我很樂意推荐這家餐廳，希望你和我一樣幸運，能夠遇上像Didier這樣優秀的侍應。I definitely recommend this restaurant if you are visiting the Royal Palace. I wish you're lucky as me to have Didier waiting your table. It'll make your day.

title_review: Nice and cozy tapas bar, with great sangria
review_preview: The bar is typically Spanish, small, noisy and full of people, but the atmosphere is great. Luis the bartender makes great sangria - tastier than the others we’ve tried in town, and Dimar the waiter treats everyone personally! He even brought compliments from the house...

title_review: Do you like electro swing music?
review_preview: The good: Service was prompt and pleasant, the paella was very good, the drinks well executed and generous. The decor with dramatically lit garden in back was exceptional.Not so good: They play obnoxious, frenetic "electro swing" music on a continuous loop in a failed...
review_full: The good: Service was prompt and pleasant, the paella was very good, the drinks well executed and generous. The decor with dramatically lit garden in back was exceptional. Not so good: They play obnoxious, frenetic "electro swing" music on a continuous loop in a failed attempt to project a hip image. Extremely annoying--this is NOT music to dine by. I swear we heard Biboulakis' "Is That Too Much To Ask?" three times in 90 minutes. We had to escape and have dessert elsewhere. BTW: If you arrive before 9:00 pm or so they'll try to seat you upfront in a more Mcdonald's-like atmosphere to make the place look busy. Don't accept that; ask for a seat near the garden or make a reservation for a garden table. With appropriate music this would easily be a 4-5 star restaurant.

title_review: Lovely service and a whole lot of food
review_preview: Mas al Sur was definitely one of the best restaurants I've tried in Madrid. First, the tapas sizes are huge. They are almost the size of what would count as a "racion" in other places. It's been 4 months since I started living in Spain,...
review_full: Mas al Sur was definitely one of the best restaurants I've tried in Madrid.  First, the tapas sizes are huge. They are almost the size of what would count as a "racion" in other places. It's been 4 months since I started living in Spain, and the sangria from Mas al Sur is the best I've ever tasted. At first, I didn't want to drink Sangria, but the waiter urged me to and I thank him for that. The glass was huge and I loved every drop of it.  The service of the restaurant was some of the best I've experienced in Spain. Every single person was kind and attentive. They even gave us 3 free shots on the house.  If I ever visit Madrid again, I will definitely go back.

title_review: Finally got to visit---and it was worth it!
review_preview: This was the restaurant I most wanted to visit, mainly because of the excellent Tripadvisor reviews.  It was very close to my guesthouse, so I went for an early dinner (around 4:30) on a Saturday. Since I was traveling by myself, I felt more comfortable...
review_full: This was the restaurant I most wanted to visit, mainly because of the excellent Tripadvisor reviews. It was very close to my guesthouse, so I went for an early dinner (around 4:30) on a Saturday. Since I was traveling by myself, I felt more comfortable going early. And the restaurants are usually much less crowded. I know that everyone says only the tourists eat early in Madrid, and likely this is true. But even if I had dinner at 11 PM, it's still very obvious that I'm a tourist. :-) I feel that the way a restaurant treats tourists is an indication of how good they are. Some places don't make the effort to elevate your experience because they don't think you will be back. Other restaurants treat everyone with respect and consideration, and I believe that Taberna Mas Al Sur is one. It was uncrowded when I came in and sat at the bar---I love eating at the bar---and I was waited on right away by an efficient, friendly waitress. She explained the menu, and told me about the starred dishes---ones that they especially recommended. You can get a full portion (racione), or half portion, which is great if you want to sample several things. Everything sounded wonderful. Since I don't eat meat, my choices were more limited, but for people who are vegetarians or who eat seafood, there is still plenty of delicious food. I started with a tinto de verano (so good and refreshing), and chose the garlic shrimp and the spinach and cheese quiche. The quiche had a slightly more sweet flavor that I wasn't expecting, and I realized it had raisins! Different, but really good. But the shrimp---I can honestly say it was the best garlic shrimp I've ever eaten! The portion was just right, and the shrimp was so plump and juicy, with lots of buttery, garlicky sauce---perfect for sopping up the the fresh, crusty bread---and I almost hated finishing them. Soooo heavenly. I wish that I'd been able to try some of the other seafood. At the end of the meal, they offer you a complimentary "shot", which was actually more than a shot of a nice liqueur similar to Baileys. A lovely ending to a delicious meal, which was also very reasonably priced. And an added bonus---the young waiters dressed in black were all handsome and polite. :-)

They have a great list of cocktails if you're tired of wine and beer, which we were at the end of our trip. We tried the Mango Colada and the sangria, both of which were refreshing and tasty. Every plate we ordered was great as well - they have a strong South American influence on Spanish food. I would suggest the patatas bravas if you want some spice with your potatoes. The atmosphere is very nice as well. We will definitely be returning when we are in Madrid next!

review_preview: My husband and I went to Brutal bar last night based on reviews here and it didn't disappoint! I would definitely recommend making a reservation. Valentina seated us and after a few minutes informed us there was a large group about to be sat all...
review_full: My husband and I went to Brutal bar last night based on reviews here and it didn't disappoint! I would definitely recommend making a reservation.  Valentina seated us and after a few minutes informed us there was a large group about to be sat all around us and thought we would be more comfortable in a quieter table towards the front. She was so thoughtful to offer and it was a great table!  The hospitality didn't stop there. The table behind us seemed to have some serious food allergies and instead of the waiter getting annoyed, she called over another waiter who basically sat down with them and went through the whole menu explaining what they would be able to eat and what they could leave off a dish. You could see the relief in their faces how nice it was to be taken care of and not feel like a burden because of their situation. It warmed my heart!  Now, on to the food... it was delicious and quite the experience! The basil injected burrata, bacon on a line, and the octopus were the winning dishes of the night!! So fun and seriously delicious!!! I can't recommend this restaurant enough and will definitely come back next time we're in town! Francesco also took great care of us as well, bringing out some of our dishes and putting on quite the show! He also explained their dessert options and helped us make a decision! The customer service here is truly amazing! Probably better than we have ever experienced at any other restaurant around the world! If you're looking for great food, that won't empty your wallet, that's fun, and an overall wonderful experience, this is your place!!!!

review_preview: My wife and I were walking the streets of Madrid trying to find the right restaurant for our last night.  We wanted something really good and special.  Last turn, we were going to cross the street for more options and chanced upon Vinitus.   They just...
review_full: My wife and I were walking the streets of Madrid trying to find the right restaurant for our last night. We wanted something really good and special. Last turn, we were going to cross the street for more options and chanced upon Vinitus. They just opened for dinner and being famished, we thought that we would get served right away and replenish and head to a bar for some drinks. With the help of two absolutely outstanding guys at Vinitus, we had an amazing time with great tapas, seafood and outstanding sangria (one of the two best Sangrias we had in Spain). Price was well worth the quality of the food. We spent more in other places that had decent but not outstanding tapas. Ended up having one of the best times and stayed until 11pm!

The staff was very friendly and inviting. The only reason they did not get a 5 is that they were clearly too busy and the service was not timely. We asked for after dinner drinks and they brought glasses but never showed up with the drinks - they seemed to forget about us. Johnny the owner was really nice so I still would recommend it.

title_review: Great food, great service, great restaurant
review_preview: Stumbled across this place after walking around the Museo Reina Sofia, there were six of us which is quite a large party for this small restaurant but they were very hospitable, they cleared a table for us and seated us within two minutes. All the...
review_full: Stumbled across this place after walking around the Museo Reina Sofia, there were six of us which is quite a large party for this small restaurant but they were very hospitable, they cleared a table for us and seated us within two minutes. All the staff were very lovely and attentive, most of the party had beer but I had an Aperol Spritz -it was great, for once I could taste the Aperol! We ordered a large selection of dishes, everything from the large chunks of warm bread to the ham croquettes was delicious. The stand out dish for me was the squid, it was grilled rather than fried and you could cover it in lemon and dip it in the amazing, extremely garlicky aioli!  I would definitely recommend visiting this place, if ever I'm back in Madrid I will definitely return.

review_preview: Found this restaurant in trip advisor and it was the right choice. Good price-quality ratio. All the dishes we ordered were just very delicious! We ordered 5 hot dishes + 3 deserts. The serving was very fast, and it was a team work - backing...
review_full: Found this restaurant in trip advisor and it was the right choice. Good price-quality ratio. All the dishes we ordered were just very delicious! We ordered 5 hot dishes + 3 deserts. The serving was very fast, and it was a team work - backing up each other. The atmosphere was also good, even if it is full of people, it was not noisy. There are also bar places in case all the tables are occupied and you can order small tapas there and they are cooked in front of you. But we came around 19:00 and booked 30 min in advance, so there were some free tables and they actually were open earlier than it is written in the restaurant profile above. I have also found out one of the best wines for me (very sweet, desert wine - Gewurtstraminer-Gramona) which I haven’t known before. We paid around 63 euros for 2. There is one dish with octopus that many people ordered that I would like to try but we were so full that I left it for my next trip to Madrid I do recommend this restaurant and will definitely visit it next time!

This place was packed both inside and out; lots of locals. Got a table outside. The staff was really quick; they were literally running around. Food came out very quickly too. Gal friend had the Cod with Boletus sauce. It was fantastic I had the steak/filet with potato on a sizzling hot stone plate. It was GREAT. At the end, they gave us a free shot of port wine. Very nice finishing touch  And even with all of the above, it was probably the cheapest eat i had in Spain. LoL

review_preview: I have no words to describe how great this restaurant is. The food is simple and delicious, the prices are fair, the service is beyond great and the ambiance is nice and modern. The food was so good that my husband and I went there...
review_full: I have no words to describe how great this restaurant is. The food is simple and delicious, the prices are fair, the service is beyond great and the ambiance is nice and modern. The food was so good that my husband and I went there for lunch AND dinner on the same exact day. We only had 2 days to visit and explore Madrid and we chose this restaurant to visit twice in a day. It was that great. The Octopus tapa was out of this world, also the grilled leeks and pretty much everything we tried. For dinner, we ordered a bottle of wine, 6-7 seafood tapas and 2 desserts and our bill was 50 euros! I encourage everyone to go eat there and experience for themselves the great quality of of food and service this restaurant offers.

review_preview: I went here with a small group of friends from a food tour after about 4 days in Madrid. We made a reservation after being unable to get in the prior night. We had had decent tapas elsewhere. Inclan Brutal was palpably better. The setting...
review_full: I went here with a small group of friends from a food tour after about 4 days in Madrid. We made a reservation after being unable to get in the prior night. We had had decent tapas elsewhere. Inclan Brutal was palpably better.  The setting is crowded but energizing and adequately comfortable. Wide range of good tapas choices. Standout was the octopus. Tender, flavorful. Renewed my interest and banished memories of rubber tentacles. Almost nothing was less than good.  Quick and observant wait staff. Hostess Palota was charming and helpful and waiter Francesco was terrific. For tapas bars with an extensive menu, it may not get any better than this.

review_preview: This place felt like a cool and youthful stop in our tour of Madrid. The place was full of Spanish groups of friends laughing and enjoying their wine. The restaurant decor is an interesting mix of modern and vintage and has an earthy indoor outdoor...
review_full: This place felt like a cool and youthful stop in our tour of Madrid. The place was full of Spanish groups of friends laughing and enjoying their wine. The restaurant decor is an interesting mix of modern and vintage and has an earthy indoor outdoor feel.  The menu was very interesting and varied with several twists and different takes on classics such as gazpacho which was served in a martini glass. The food on a whole was delicious and unique with several pleasant surprises when the food arrived. The only slight let down was the cheesecake pudding which proved rubbery and they had ran out of the pudding we had in fact wanted. The drinks here are also delicious and the wine very cheap, dangerously so in fact!  The service was friendly and attentive and it is obviously a favourite for birthday celebrations as we saw three in our visit! Good for a relaxed meal with a cooler vibe if you fancy something different from your traditional tapas lunch!

However this place do not serve paella in single portion, so I was paying double price, thinking of eat half and take out the rest half.But it turned out I was very disappointed at their paella that I just left the rest of it without taking them. The seafood on top was actually nice so at least I could eat those, but the rice was so hard to chew on, I notice the rice in paella is usually more chewy, but I believe there's a difference between chewy and not cooked throughly. also the scent of the seafood does not go on the rice, I could only taste the saltiness around them. After they noticed I was unhappy with the dish, they were nice to offer me: 1. to redo the dish again 2. change to another dish 3. Treat me a desert But I don't want to wait another 20 min for them to recook a paella which I'm not sure how it will turn out, and any other dish on the menu was around €6, which does not justify the €30 I'm paying for the paella. They wined up treating me a desert, plus made the sangria I ordered free of charge, which again, very nice of them. But for a tourist that was hoping to have a nice paella during a short stay in Madrid, it is just such a bummer. The sangria and the desert they treated me was actually really nice, and most customers there looks happy. so I would say if you wanna have a drink, some small dishes or desert, maybe give it a try. But for paella, maybe somewhere else.

We said we wanted to give it a try as it is a Madrilean speciality, but were not sure if we like it. He immediately confessed he didn't and that he preferred "carne limpia" - which we had already ordered as main. The tripes were OK, but the meat was really "espectacular", along with the Ribera del Duero. If you like meat, go for it!

title_review: This is a difficult one! 5 and 0 Stars.
review_preview: It just shows that timing can be everything.I had one of the best meals of my life here last week on Thursday 18th July and then one of the worst meals of my life here last Sunday 21st July.This restaurant/tapas bar was just...
review_full: It just shows that timing can be everything. I had one of the best meals of my life here last week on Thursday 18th July and then one of the worst meals of my life here last Sunday 21st July. This restaurant/tapas bar was just around the corner from our apartment, and we were delighted to find such a lovely restaurant on our doorstep. The owner seems a lovely man, and we had interesting conversations in a mixture of Spanish and English about the food and Galicia in general. We had a hugely enjoyable meal.  I had the best entrecote I have ever eaten, and my other half had a gorgeous piece of hake in a subtle cinnamon sauce. The postres of chocolate mousse with mint and the tangerine sorbet were also delightful. Buoyed up by this, I changed my plans to cook Sunday dinner and made reservations for the relatively early time of 21:30. This time we were shown into the La Cueva part of the restaurant, which would have been lovely, had they had any food left! No hake, one rather sad entrecote left, cod with peppers without any peppers, no complementary tapa. The vegetables consisted of a small sliver of lettuce, which, frankly, I found insulting. The owner said that the chef had "let him down", and that this was the first time it had ever happened, but still did nothing to rectify it or adjust the bill accordingly. It turns out that the Russian ice-skaters had arrived for Cinderella on Ice across the way at Sabatini, and had already taken the lion's share of everything. Nevertheless this was Madrid, it was only 21:30 and we had a reservation. I quote from the owner: " Oh, you were so happy, and now you are so sad." Well, yes, exactly. If I hadn't gone back, I would have been praising this place to the heavens. Now, …meh.. take your chances, as it's clearly random.

They gave us free soups whilst we waited and tasty liqueurs at the end plus the biggest slabs of bread so we all really enjoyed the meal. The second night my husband and son shared paella which looked wonderful and my son and I had meats cooked on the parilla. This restaurant is on a side street near the Palace between the latter and the senate house/Plaza de Espana. It was a great find and I am sure anyone would enjoy it.

review_preview: We had checked the reviews before deciding to enter. They did not lie or exaggerate!! When we entered we were greeted by a very friendly person behind the bar, they were busy, but told us if we could wait for just a bit they could...
review_full: We had checked the reviews before deciding to enter. They did not lie or exaggerate!! When we entered we were greeted by a very friendly person behind the bar, they were busy, but told us if we could wait for just a bit they could handle our party of 5. To ease our wait they offered us a glass of wine and a large plate of olives to snack on. The wine and olives were delicious, the atmosphere warm and homey. We decided to stay and wait. We loved it!! Our wait was maybe 20- 30 minutes, but as we didn't have reservations this was more than acceptable, eventually we were lead downstairs to our table where our waiter Angel was just finishing setting the table for us. The room was magnificent with barrel vaulting and old world charm. We ordered more of the house wine and a mixture of appetizers to start. Everything we tried was excellent from the homemade croquettes and escargot, to the tapas and goat cheese salad. For our entree we ordered the mixed paella and 1/4 roasted little goat. Angel kept us supplied in wine and cervasa as the dishes continued to arrive and just as quickly were consumed. Can't really say enough good things about the evening, even after getting back home when we were trying to come up with dinner plans I was thinking I would sure like some more roasted goat.  The cost is very affordable, for 5 adults (including 3 bottles of wine) the cost was around 160 Euros (or about $200 US) I have spent more in US restaurants where the food and service weren't nearly as good!!

review_preview: Stumbled on this place with friends whilst wandering up to the Palacio Real via the gardens. Looked inviting from the outside and even though we lunched at a very touristy time of 12:30pm the 3 of us all had from start to finish a great...
review_full: Stumbled on this place with friends whilst wandering up to the Palacio Real via the gardens. Looked inviting from the outside and even though we lunched at a very touristy time of 12:30pm the 3 of us all had from start to finish a great experience. First, the coffee was the best we'd had for quite some time. Then the Sangria was some of the best we'd had... then the lunches / tapas were tasty n great. The Bacalou Salad was awesome as was the Chorizo from Hell (although not as hellish as I expected... just very good). As we were there so early (with respect to the local Madrilenos) we only saw a few locals slide in and out for a quite drink and early tapa. We enjoyed sitting out the front in the beautiful day, near a busy section of road but the above food n drink set our moods in the right frame of mind. Looks like it'd be a popular place at the right time, they were just firing up the wood fire grill at the back of the restaurant when we left. Recommend a visit to all.

This restaurant is highly recommended if you are after great food, atmosphere and company :) we wish to be back again already.

review_preview: Found this great place wandering through Madrid. Has a bar and a beautiful downstairs dinning room. One part of the dinning room is a secret old tunnel that was used by the Royal Palace which is right around the corner. I was greeted by the...
review_full: Found this great place wandering through Madrid. Has a bar and a beautiful downstairs dinning room. One part of the dinning room is a secret old tunnel that was used by the Royal Palace which is right around the corner.  I was greeted by the head waiter David who was an absolute pleasure to be served by. He was very knowledgable about everything on the menu. The meat selection was amazing and all Spanish as we were showed personally before it was cooked on their in house charcoal grill. I ordered a steak and my girl friend ordered a pork cut called 'presa'. Both meals were outstanding but the pork really stood out. Their wine selection was very nice with a lot of variety. They also had the iconic Jamon Iberico which was seen throughout the bar area. The desserts all looked good but we settled on the cream cheese mouse with berries which was just right after a very good steak. There were no tourists that I noticed so was good to get away from all the tourist traps that were in the area. The prices were very reasonable for the quality we received compared to the other restaurants that we visited in the couple days before on our trip. Can't wait to go back and see what is in store for next time. Make sure you ask for David and you will not be disappointed. A++

review_preview: Had high expectations for this restaurant, seeing as it is rated #47 out of all restaurants in Madrid. I could not have been more disappointed. The 1 star is for Santiago, our waiter who was the only saving grace for our meal. Had reserved a...
review_full: Had high expectations for this restaurant, seeing as it is rated #47 out of all restaurants in Madrid. I could not have been more disappointed. The 1 star is for Santiago, our waiter who was the only saving grace for our meal. Had reserved a table in advance and it took a while for anyone to notice us waiting to be seated - were then shoved to the back of the restaurant in a corner (I think this is where they put all the non-Spanish speaking "tourists"). Waited over 20 minutes for a drinks order to be taken. It was almost an hour before food was served. Ordered 5 plates of tapas to share between two. Two of the first three dishes were stone cold - for this reason the risotto was inedible but I ate my half as I was starving. We told Santiago this and he assured us the next two plates would be served at the proper temperature - which they were. Don't bother ordering the "bacon on a clothesline". If sharing, you get 1 slice of bacon blow-torched at your table. It is very much a case of style over substance. The tuna however, was very tasty. By this point, we just wanted to pay and go. But means of trying to compensate us, we were given a complimentary Green Tea Panna Cotta. When my sister said she hated Green Tea we were then given 4 complimentary test tubes of a drink a-kin to Baileys. Not sure what pillows stuck to the wall with black and white film reels projected over them does for the ambiance of the restaurant. I really hate leaving bad reviews, but apart from Santiago who, bless him, was rushed off his feet tending to at least 2 tables of 15 plus others I have no other positive things to say. Avoid unless you want a 'weird and bad' under-staffed experience (in the words of my sister).

review_full: Not a lot to look at, from outside, but pretty, authentic and welcoming inside. We found it simply by chance as we were waiting to get into our apartment next door. Friendly staff and traditional. Originally downstairs was an "airing room" for the Iberian Hams, but now it is a lovely cellar restaurant. One night we had a lovely steak and another night "Tapas" upstairs in a relaxing bar. All the food was very good. Staff were excellent. Very reasonably priced wine list...but not the Vega de Sicilia !!! Great selection of Hams including the best 5J... they also run the butchers nearby, so they know their stuff. Highly recommended.

Food was excellent and trying to be imaginatively presented as well in a modern style (e.g. dry ice underneath the tuna, some form of blue cheese rolled up in edible cigars etc). We went as a group of friends and had a variety of dishes which we all shared and all were good - particular highlights were the mushroom orso and seared tuna. Prices were reasonable, particularly for the centre of town. Only bad point - and I would agree with another reviewer - was the annoying waiter Christian, who also spent the evening trying to take the mickey out of / impersonate our accents. Once might have been amusing, all night started to get a bit wearing. Helena on front desk was brilliant though.

Very fairly priced wine list, and a powerful aguardiente as (free) digestif - no limoncello!

title_review: Excellent Tapas, Very Good Galician Beef at La Mi Venta
review_preview: La Mi Venta was a very happy find for a friend and myself for a leisurely light dinner.  We were heading for a couple of other tapas places near the Palacio Royal and I just liked the look of La Mi Venta as we walked...
review_full: La Mi Venta was a very happy find for a friend and myself for a leisurely light dinner. We were heading for a couple of other tapas places near the Palacio Royal and I just liked the look of La Mi Venta as we walked by. The evening was warm enough to sit outside for dinner but the inside was cosy and appealing as well. There are two beautiful dining rooms downstairs which would be great for a private group, one is in an ancient cellar space with stone walls. Very nice. David was the main server the night we stopped in. His warm welcome and fluent English made us feel very welcome. We tried three tapas, including migas--- a dish I had on my list to try but have shied away from in places where it often is an oily overly garlicy mass of bread cubes. La Mi Venta's version was delicious. Excellent hams and charcuterie, the pisto (warm, oil poached vegetables sort of like a Spanish Ratatouille) were all very, very good and high quality. Glasses of excellent Riojas were generous and fairly priced. We also ordered a large green salad to round out our 'light' dinner and it was a beautiful plate of uber-fresh greens dressed with delicious olive oil. Talking with David about their meats, including the Galician 'buey' steaks, we decided to return the next evening to order those. Good choice. Prices were very fair, I thought, for the quality of the tapas and the main dishes. This is definitely on my list to go back to when I am in Madrid again. Just the kind of place you wish you had in your neighborhood.

review_preview: Until we got lucky and were redirected to Inclán Brutal Bar, we had been disappointed by the food culture in Madrid. This quickly changed as the very helpful and friendly staff helped us pick out an exquisite dinner consisting of dishes small and large, pleasing...
review_full: Until we got lucky and were redirected to Inclán Brutal Bar, we had been disappointed by the food culture in Madrid. This quickly changed as the very helpful and friendly staff helped us pick out an exquisite dinner consisting of dishes small and large, pleasing both to our eyes and our palates. The different tapas we tried were great, as was the paella. We enjoyed both local dishes such as their ham croquettes and grilled octopus tentacle, as well as Asian influenced dishes like the tuna tataki. Their "Super Tapa" sizes were perfect for sharing among a small group of friends. The only thing bland were the desserts, which were decent, but not great. This did not detract from the experience however, as the rest of the food, the service and the decor made sure that we had our best night out in Madrid!

title_review: good for a snack and special occassions
review_preview: We hae booked it for Valentines and my husband's birthday. We have arrived at 8pm and were the only couple there apart from 2 people at the bar. It was good as at least we knew we can order quick and leave eralier. It appears...
review_full: We hae booked it for Valentines and my husband's birthday. We have arrived at 8pm and were the only couple there apart from 2 people at the bar. It was good as at least we knew we can order quick and leave eralier. It appears there is a space with tables upstairs to have tapas or pinchos and a drink but also proper restaurant downstairs with white tablecloths etc.  We have picked recommended house wine for only 14 euros which was very nice. We have been serviced with ham soup, lovely huge slice of bread and olive oil (all not ordered, just extras) . Apparently soup was very salty ( I didnt try as I do not eat meat). We have ordered ham croquetts, toast with tuna belley and carmelised tomatoes and deep fried cheese stick for a starters. All very nice. Then my husband had some beef steak and I had cod deep fried in batter. Both meals were accompnied by same sides (potatoes with fried onions and pepers plus padron peppers. I dont think there was any choice. Beef was apparently nice but my cod was huge hence undercooked inside. I had only eaten cooked bits and left most of it, I didnt want to make a scene and ruin atmosphere. Sides were lovely though. We have decided not to go for desserts but rather head to San Miguel Market for some sweet snacks.  Prices were different then on the website but still affordable I would say. Portions of food were good but was not that keen on service. It took a while to clear our plates after main meal and get attention to ask for a bill - even if there were only 5 tables in the room. I am not sure it is because our original waiter was busy in other room or the second one that suppose take over was too bussy fussing around the guy who has ordered quite expensive bottle of wine and did not pay much attention to others? We have paid 75 euros in total which wasnt too bad and food was lovely.

review_preview: I decided to go to La Mi Venta with a colleague of mine after checking reviews on Tripadvisor and I am pleased to say it was a really great experience. As we walked in the place was quite empty, but already from the outside we...
review_full: I decided to go to La Mi Venta with a colleague of mine after checking reviews on Tripadvisor and I am pleased to say it was a really great experience. As we walked in the place was quite empty, but already from the outside we got a good feeling: the place did not look like a tourist trap and inside the bar was an authentic Spanish place. Tapas starters were truly delicious and big portions as well. After sharing 2 tapas platters we only had room for salads, and these were outstanding (we had one goat cheese and one smoked cod salad) ! Wine from the house was perfect (a Crianza at 14,90 euro) and service friendly and attentive. A great surprise and a place to recommend, I will be back when in Madrid again, it is also very central even if a bit tucked away (which makes the whole experience nice and cozy).

I then realized he was giving other tables (from which I could hear were Spanish customers) large glass bottles of tap water. I am an avid 'non' plastic user where possible so I was extremely annoyed and of course, bottled water costs a lot more. I did send the bottled water we hadn't opened back and asked for bottled water in the end, but I can't blame miscommunication as I am bilingual and I felt like we were being pushed for our money because the majority of the group were 'dumb tourists'. I wouldn't go back.

title_review: Great way to kick off our Madrid visit
review_preview: The atmosphere, service, value, and food were excellent. A few colleagues and I stopped by Mas al Sur based on recommendations from Trip advisor to kick off our first night in Madrid. We had Lucas as our server and he was friendly, genuine, attentive and...
review_full: The atmosphere, service, value, and food were excellent. A few colleagues and I stopped by Mas al Sur based on recommendations from Trip advisor to kick off our first night in Madrid.  We had Lucas as our server and he was friendly, genuine, attentive and made good recommendations. We requested a table outside and was seated within 5 minutes. Between the 3 of us we sampled about 1/4 of the dinner menu. The prawns were so tasty, we ordered 2 large orders. The octopus was tender and savory. We also had the salmon which was good but not the star of the menu; salad with goat cheese; wook noodles and mushrooms were flavorful. The Cuban shredded pork was deliciously silky smooth and the cod was cooked and seasoned just right were the two star dishes for this restaurant. We had a local beer and the sangria was great. We finished the night with a fruit pie that was just excellent! We were completely full by the end of the night and the total cost was very reasonable which highlights the value of this restaurant. I would recommend to others who are looking for a casual and savory dinner with friends in Madrid. Will bookmark this for our next visit!

review_preview: We were in Madrid for two days and went every day -- that's how good this place is. There's a relaxed vibe with cool unobtrusive music, a mix of high and low tables, and a pleasant comfy decor. The service (Jorge) was super friendly; he...
review_full: We were in Madrid for two days and went every day -- that's how good this place is. There's a relaxed vibe with cool unobtrusive music, a mix of high and low tables, and a pleasant comfy decor. The service (Jorge) was super friendly; he recommended yummy foods and we got complimentary tapas and shots. The food has good vegan and veg options and was really tasty. The portions were just right. We had to be careful to arrive at the right time of day for lunch / afternoon / supper (which is probably a Madrid thing). The crispy ravioli were outstanding; the potato wedges totally moreish; and the pannacotta with amaretto out of this world. You could easily hang out here for hours (and we did). :-)

review_preview: Our Airbnb host, Esteban, recommended this tapas spot. It was literally a two minute walk from Esteban's apartment. We ordered the Iberico bacon risotto (half), bacalao (half), and the steak. It was a lot of food for two people and we weren't able to finish...
review_full: Our Airbnb host, Esteban, recommended this tapas spot. It was literally a two minute walk from Esteban's apartment. We ordered the Iberico bacon risotto (half), bacalao (half), and the steak. It was a lot of food for two people and we weren't able to finish it all. The food was good, and our favorite was probably the risotto (sucker for those bacon bits). The bacalao had bones, so just be aware. Service was good and the staff was friendly. As with many Spanish restaurants, there was an English menu. We went early, but walking by on other nights, this place gets pretty busy.

review_preview: This was one of the most memorable travel experiences we’ve ever had. The food was ridiculously good (rack of lamb was as tender as I’ve ever had, and the sea bass was flaky and delicious), the wine selection was great, and the show was really...
review_full: This was one of the most memorable travel experiences we’ve ever had. The food was ridiculously good (rack of lamb was as tender as I’ve ever had, and the sea bass was flaky and delicious), the wine selection was great, and the show was really fun. The booking process was easy, and the venue was quaint.  But what really made the night was our waiter, Jose. He was attentive and professional, but without hovering. He taught us about the Spanish wine regions and brought out different kinds of wines for us to try. It was clear that he loved the wine and teaching others about the country, and his enthusiasm really enhanced our experience. Thank you, Jose!

title_review: the cocido is great, but the people are the best!
review_preview: We enjoyed our very first taste of cocido madrileno here, and it was delicious... and gigantic! Seriously, I eat more than anybody I know, and I struggled to finish my share of the epic feast. If you're a visitor to Madrid, cocido is something you...
review_full: We enjoyed our very first taste of cocido madrileno here, and it was delicious... and gigantic! Seriously, I eat more than anybody I know, and I struggled to finish my share of the epic feast. If you're a visitor to Madrid, cocido is something you need to experience at least once before you leave. More importantly, the staff here was absolutely wonderful: patient with our accented Spanish and our fussy 13-month-old, and wonderfully warm. They'll teach you everything you need to know about enjoying Madrid's legendary cocido. Just make reservations ahead of time! It's a small restaurant, and it's understandably popular.

review_preview: The hostel was very close to Plaza de Tirso de Molina, and that has a handful of that particular kind of restaurant that always pops up around railway stations and metro stops: seductive but touristic (which doesn't mean the food is bad at all...) but...
review_full: The hostel was very close to Plaza de Tirso de Molina, and that has a handful of that particular kind of restaurant that always pops up around railway stations and metro stops: seductive but touristic (which doesn't mean the food is bad at all...) but in the other direction, round the corner on Calle de Lavapiés is this fantastic little local place. Good things have been said, all of which I agree with. But given that it is inspired by the seaside resort of Cabo Roig, I might have expected a little more seafood. We all have wishes...! A nice, incidental detail: happened to hear music from my own country (NZ) on the sound system: Sola Rosa, in Madrid.

review_preview: Visited on a Monday evening based on TripAdvisor reviews. Very understate exterior, and not situated in the best part of town but once inside it is warm and friendly. Don't get caught out by the sliding door at the entrance (I think it has to...
review_full: Visited on a Monday evening based on TripAdvisor reviews. Very understate exterior, and not situated in the best part of town but once inside it is warm and friendly. Don't get caught out by the sliding door at the entrance (I think it has to be opened by staff), it's a little off putting. Decor is minimalistic , with plenty of paintings and prints of the "Cabo". The menu majors on Tapas & Racion portions with a limited number of mains and a specials board. The sharing portions are generous and very well presented. Food quality was excellent and prices are very reasonable.  While the dining area is small they can pack a good number of customer in when needed. So be prepared to meet your neighbours!  The 'host' waiter is very efficient, friendly and the service was spot on. There is a good wine list and plenty of different beers on offer. Prices for the better wines was slightly higher than normal.  Overall, good food, good drink and a very convivial dining location.

review_preview: On vacation in Spain we visited el Rincon del Cabo because of its TA rating and reviews.  We found the food creative and generally really good. We shared steak, meatballs, and some grilled banana, salsa and avocado creation. Not being one for avocado, I cannot...
review_full: On vacation in Spain we visited el Rincon del Cabo because of its TA rating and reviews. We found the food creative and generally really good. We shared steak, meatballs, and some grilled banana, salsa and avocado creation.  Not being one for avocado, I cannot personally endorse it, but the ladies loved it. The meatballs I thought were pretty good but the other guy with us wasn’t wild about it. The steak was excellent for the area, and almost as good as a sirloin in an excellent North American steak house. The fried potato cubes were also great. The sangria we collectively rated as the second best we have had so far (and we have had a few).  The server was friendly, helpful, attentive and had a great sense of humour The entire meal for four with Sangria and a beer was less than 50 Euro.  The only detractors were that some of the seats were a little uncomfortable, and since the place was small and seemed to have a regular Saturday night crowd of locals, it was a little noisy.  But it was certainly worth the experience.

title_review: Stunning tapas and home to the famous Casa Lolea sangria Nos. 1, 2, 3, 4
review_preview: Stylish fun restaurant, tucked away on a side street in the fashionable Chueca neighbourhood. Tapas are delicious and some of the best! Also home of the famous Casa Lolea sangrias, which are now exported around the world.Friendly waitresses show you to your table and...
review_full: Stylish fun restaurant, tucked away on a side street in the fashionable Chueca neighbourhood. Tapas are delicious and some of the best!  Also home of the famous Casa Lolea sangrias, which are now exported around the world. Friendly waitresses show you to your table and helpfully explain to you their à la carte menu as well as their formule which is very good value. Their Spanish Tortilla is a show-stopper! Delicate oozy melt-in-your-mouth centre and softly browned exterior. Seriously THE Best! Also outstanding is the falso risotto con tartufo (actually orzo?? not rice) served in a silky smooth sauce with topping of truffle which they suggest you mix into the risotto to flavour, just before you eat. Tastes sublime! Had to order this on every visit

review_preview: We were very warmly greeted in this restaurant and the owner took her time to explain all the dishes to us. The menu was extensive enough to offer something for everyone's taste but thankfully focused on authentic mexican food instead of the ubiquitous tex-mex nachos...
review_full: We were very warmly greeted in this restaurant and the owner took her time to explain all the dishes to us. The menu was extensive enough to offer something for everyone's taste but thankfully focused on authentic mexican food instead of the ubiquitous tex-mex nachos & fajitas. All dishes were outstanding (and were accompanied by an explanation on how to best eat them), the guacamole was out-of-this-world delicious and the margarita and michelada were just as good. Really nothing you could find at fault with this gem of a place. Our meal finished with two Mexican coffees tasting of cinnamon and orange peel - when we return to Madrid, we will surely drop by again!
