title_review: Excellent restaurant for you to enjoy a traditional Madrileño cocido lunch.  Just be sure to book ahead!
review_preview: Cocido is a tradicional Madrileño lunch which is like a kind of stew. A broth with fine noodles is served at first (bottomless), then vegetables and chickpeas, then, finally the selection of meats (beef, pork, ham, morcilla, chorizo, bone marrow....).  Everything is cooked in the...
review_full: Cocido is a tradicional Madrileño lunch which is like a kind of stew. A broth with fine noodles is served at first (bottomless), then vegetables and chickpeas, then, finally the selection of meats (beef, pork, ham, morcilla, chorizo, bone marrow....). Everything is cooked in the delicious broth and you can mix and match all the elements together on your own plate, to your liking. You have the option of the addition of onion, chilli and a paprika sauce too! This restaurant is well known for its cocido and with the very friendly and welcoming service from Lola and the team, its a great place to try the dish. The restaurant is only open for lunch and only Tuesdays - Saturdays. They are popular so be sure to book ahead. I booked in person a few days ahead and confirmed that I wanted cocido at the time of booking. We really enjoyed our meal here, and the service. The different meats were all delicious and we couldn't stop at just 2 bowls of broth. The cocido itself is around EUR 20 per person, all up, with our drinks and coffee the total bill came to EUR 55 (2 people). Make sure you arrive hungry. And allow plenty of time to enjoy the meal and the service (and for a siesta afterwards).

We had some of the tastiest Pinchos I have ever sampled with a delicious honey based sauce,excellent chicken empanadas, croquettes with cod which were very slightly underseasoned but were beautifully cooked and a bowl of burrata, a light, fluffy cheese similar to Mozzarella served with dressing and finely chopped salad. Washed down with a couple of Belgian craft beers and rounded off with coffee, the bill came out at a scrottle over €35, which we both considered good value. In conclusion, impeccable service from two good guys who take justifiable pride in their first class food. Recommend booking ahead. We did and were glad we did so....

title_review: Thank you TripAdvisor reviewers; we would never have experienced this great little place without you
review_preview: My wife and I had been sightseeing in Madrid for about 4 hours, having landed from the US that day. It was hot and we were looking for a somewhere peaceful, away from the many touristy places near the Plaza Mayor. El Rincon del Cabo...
review_full: My wife and I had been sightseeing in Madrid for about 4 hours, having landed from the US that day. It was hot and we were looking for a somewhere peaceful, away from the many touristy places near the Plaza Mayor. El Rincon del Cabo caught my eye in the list of nearby restaurants. After a brief walk into the less crowded back streets, we found it and did a double take. It was not at all attractive from the outside. It was very small and empty (although it was still early for lunch by Spanish standards), and the décor was quirky. Without TripAdvisor we would not have ventured inside but we are glad we did. The gentleman who served us, presumably one of the owners, was very welcoming and helpful. We had local beer, a potato and onion omelet, and three open faced sandwiches. The food was excellent, as was the value for money and service. Don't expect fine dining, just enjoy.

title_review: Best Flamenco show and great food
review_preview: Ive been in this flamenco tablao 3 times now. Every time I come to Madrid with international or national friends I take them There.its a mandatory stop in Madrid If you appreciate good food and art. The flamenco show is overwhelmingly passionate and the music...
review_full: Ive been in this flamenco tablao 3 times now. Every time I come to Madrid with international or national friends I take them There.its a mandatory stop in Madrid If you appreciate good food and art.  The flamenco show is overwhelmingly passionate and the music is fantastic. It’s pure noisy, loud flamenco being danced and sang just a few metres in front of you.  The food is very nice, classic Spanish food. Pricey but incredibly high quality and well cooked. The waiters are super nice and all speak English. Oscar our waiter was hyper nice. The room is as it was 60 years ago, full of history charm and stories so don’t expect a big theatre style place. It’s a lovely and charming environment where you probably are seated on the exact same vintage wooden chair as Marlon Brando or Marlene Dietrich were one day.  Some advice , if you want to try the food but you want to be able to chat with your group, book the separate dinner in the other room and then you will be moved to the flamenco show.  If you don’t mind or have short time you can also chose to do dinner during the show. It’s a bit more uncomfortable since you are eating in the dark and you can’t really talk. Anyway the dancers and musicians will leave you speechless so you will not want to be chatting during the show .  Ive also opted for going just for a drink and the show when my friends preferred a more relaxed tapas style dinner.  In summary: don’t miss it !!

title_review: Incredible Flamenco at Corral de la Moreria
review_preview: Corral de la Moreria is a dinner and Flamenco dance club which has been open more than 50 years. We ate dinner there from 9-10PM, and then watched the show from 10PM to about midnight. Desert and after dinner drinks were served during breaks. The...
review_full: Corral de la Moreria is a dinner and Flamenco dance club which has been open more than 50 years. We ate dinner there from 9-10PM, and then watched the show from 10PM to about midnight. Desert and after dinner drinks were served during breaks. The food was good. There are 4 menus to choose from. They range from 72 euros to 130 euros with a show, depending on what food you order. The show was incredible. They have their own guitar players and singers. First there are 4 dancers in a show. Then there are the featured dancers. I don't know how to describe it except to say it was mesmerizing. It seemed only a short time before the 2 hours was up. A couple of observations - the dance stage is very small and it took a great deal of skill to do what these dancers did in that space. Second, the guitar players and singers have making themselves NOT be noticed to an art. Don't leave Madrid without seeing Flamenco. If you want to go to the very best, go to Corral de la Moreria.

review_preview: Corral De La Moreria is based on the tablaos, the traditional Spanish flamenco bars that offered music while their guests were drinking. In the Corral this traditional concept is taken to new heights: the food is of the highest standard and so are the flamenco...
review_full: Corral De La Moreria is based on the tablaos, the traditional Spanish flamenco bars that offered music while their guests were drinking. In the Corral this traditional concept is taken to new heights: the food is of the highest standard and so are the flamenco artists. You can dine from the menu or choose from different menus, ranging from 40 to 80 Euro's. Wine arrangements are also available at decent prices. If you only want to have dinner without the show - the restaurant has one Michelin star - there is a separate small room available with just a few tables. Service is friendly, attentive and pleasantly informal. We chose a four course meal and were really impressed by the quality of the food - the best we've had so far in Madrid. Until this evening we were a little bit disappointed about our 5-day city trip to Madrid, but this evening alone was worth the entire journey. It is truly a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Yes, it will cost you a fair amount of money (including tips, tickets, dinner and excellent wines, we paid about € 300 for two persons). Yes, the tables are too close together. Yes, there is this slight feeling of "being processed" because the second show will start shortly after. Yes, it is a pity that you probably will not have finished your dinner when the show starts, so service goes on. But if you set all that aside, you will have one of the best evenings in your life. 1 of 1,000 things to see before you die? Absolutely!

review_preview: We had high hopes for the dinner and show as we booked this while in Madrid to celebrate our 15 year wedding anniversary. To say it was poor is an understatement. I opted for the four course meal + wine & show to make the...
review_full: We had high hopes for the dinner and show as we booked this while in Madrid to celebrate our 15 year wedding anniversary. To say it was poor is an understatement. I opted for the four course meal + wine & show to make the night as special as possible. I should have known we were in for a rough night when they sat us in front of a pole to watch the show, so we had an obscured view. For $300 you would expect a better seat. The next disappointment was that the meal was prefixe with no flexibility. This was not advertised in advance and I am not a fish fan, so half the meals I did not eat. Next came the rack of lamb which was very small and gave me four satisfying bites of a meal. I eagerly awaited dessert as I was hoping for redemption and the waiter never even bothered to show up again, which I think had something to do with us preparing in advance. If you’re keeping score I had some rack of lamb and that’s it. Not bad for $300 right?  The one saving grace was that the show and performers were spectacular. If you have the option to see them with as little frills as possible go for it as you will not be disappointed. Overall the entertainment is great and they surround it with subpar food, service and super small portions. I would avoid this like the plague.

I’ll send a review in for the show under the activities section.

title_review: Beautiful flamenco, delicious food, great service
review_preview: My experience at Corral de la Moreria was everything I could have hoped for and more.  The flamenco performance was very impressive. I had great service from start to finish.  As I went on my own the table I was seated at felt a bit...
review_full: My experience at Corral de la Moreria was everything I could have hoped for and more. The flamenco performance was very impressive. I had great service from start to finish. As I went on my own the table I was seated at felt a bit awkward to me as I was in the middle of an archway facing a wall but I had a great view of the show and I was well tended to by the staff. One small issue I had was resolved immediately, I had no candle at my table as everyone else did and you eat during the show with the lights mostly off. But this is not a complaint , as soon as I asked for some light they were very apologetic and brought me a candle immediately. My water and wine were consistently being topped up. I ordered the salmon which is cooked at a low temperature and it was absolutely delicious. They also brought me a lovely desert on the house. The host at the door, Juanma, was very kind and helpful as it was my first night in Madrid and I was looking to find somewhere to go and he gave many helpful suggestions. I really had a lovely time. And as I danced flamenco as a child, it has always been a dream to go to Spain to see the real thing. I couldn't think of a better place!

title_review: Fun and casual to take my customers for dinner
review_preview: Last Thursday I had in Madrid some customers from different countries that I had to entertain. And the decision to take them to Casa Lolea turned to be a great choice! It's clear it's not a 3-Michelin-star restaurant, but neither we wanted that. It's a...
review_full: Last Thursday I had in Madrid some customers from different countries that I had to entertain. And the decision to take them to Casa Lolea turned to be a great choice!  It's clear it's not a 3-Michelin-star restaurant, but neither we wanted that. It's a fun and relaxed place. The food is casual but as good as it can get within these parameters: way better than just OK. (and for the record, I'm local, so I know what I'm talking about) The waiter was helpful, relaxed and efficient. And he spoke good English as well!  Regarding price, I don't think it was anything specially expensive. I'd say it was OK. I'll repeat. No doubt!

Sorry but it was complete disappointment for us.

title_review: When they hold the wine glass by the stem, you know it gonna be good!
review_preview: I had executed a perfect trip to Spain for my girlfriends until the night of our attendance to Corral de la Moreria. I accidentaly flubbed our reservation time, but at the door, the staff treated me with respect and quickly corrected my mistake. They did...
review_full: I had executed a perfect trip to Spain for my girlfriends until the night of our attendance to Corral de la Moreria. I accidentaly flubbed our reservation time, but at the door, the staff treated me with respect and quickly corrected my mistake. They did not have to do this, but we were certainly glad they did as this became our favorite night of the entire trip! We were waited on by Jorge, who made us feel VIP regardless of our own mess up! He saved the night! Jorge was very poised, had excellent knowledge of the wine and made great recommendations for dinner. I would absolutely recommend making this part of your trip to Madrid. The show was breathtaking (literally, the talent was a 10 all around!), and after leaving I found out that the restaurant has now received Michelin status. Way to go! Much deserved! Thank you Jorge and Corral de la Moreria for making our trip to Madrid so memorable. I will be visiting again.

I only had a 14 hour layover in Madrid, so I decided to addend the last performance of the night on a Sunday, and I am so glad that I did! This was the second time I had seen Flamenco live and the passion and skill of everyone involved was outstanding. Prior to the show, the 4 course meal was absolutely delicious as well. I found the entire atmosphere to be charming, and I appreciated the pamphlet that told me a little about the history of the venue. I had no idea that so many famous people had visited this location! I will definitely return next time I am in Madrid.

review_preview: On a recent visit to Madrid with my sister, we dined at this restaurant at the recommendation of one of the employees at our hotel. We were very specific that we didn't want to dine at a "tourist trap" and wanted to experience really good...
review_full: On a recent visit to Madrid with my sister, we dined at this restaurant at the recommendation of one of the employees at our hotel. We were very specific that we didn't want to dine at a "tourist trap" and wanted to experience really good Spanish tapas. He was very honest and said that you will see other visitors dining there, but it is by no means a tourist restaurant. He was 100% right, and we absolutely loved our meal!  Atmosphere: The first thing that struck me, even before sampling the food or famous sangria, was the cool branding. Their signature red and white polka dots (or variations of them) were prominently yet tastefully displayed throughout the restaurant. I particularly loved the wall of bottles (an art installation) and the use of a different color bottle to represent each type of sangria.  Food: You'll find a combination of classic tapas with a twist along with some unique dishes that I didn't see elsewhere. Everything we ordered was tasty but here are some of our favorites:  1) Risotto with truffle oil  2) Croquetas de jamon (though they offered a fun option to try 4 different kinds, which we did)  3) Roast Beef with onion on toast point  4) Sangria #1 - Red  We enjoyed our meal and the service so much the first night, that we went back on our final evening in Madrid (before flying home to the states).  Overall: Definitely check out this restaurant if you want a lovely and fun dining experience. Make a reservation though, especially on weekends as it gets busy.

Vegetarian and sea food dishes were excellent. We had a range of everything, but few great to mention: mushroom croquettes were just fantastic and way better than we had in some other places, all tuna dishes were fresh and delicious, and one example of creativity was a gazpacho with watermelon, could drink that every morning. And not to forget the truffle risotto (no rise, but pasta). And on top of everything the staff was friendly, helpful, efficient and English speaking. The location is also great, just few blocks from Gran Via and in the middle of the vibrant nightlife. Go there and enjoy! Pro-tip: you can also buy a takeaway drink from their street kiosk with you to chill at the streets for a while after dinner.

title_review: Great Flamenco, but couldn't see it properly

review_full: This place boasts about being in the Michelin Guide and in the "1000 places to see before you die" book, and also about the amazing quality of their Flamenco Dancers. All this is true, of course, the Flamenco is really amazing here. The only problem is that unless you have a front-line seat, you won't be unable to see most of the show. We went there with a dinner + show reservation and were given a seat at the back of the place. The place was crammed, and having do many people in front of me could have been a problem by itself. But the awful thing is that they just keep serving dinners during the show, so all I sould see for a very long time were the waiters' heads and ands carrying full and empty dishes around. They really shouldn't allow dinners to go on during the show. I tried to stand and lean against the wall but then I was of hinder to the waiters' jobs.  I would have preferred to see a less awarded flamenco, but at least I would have seen something. The food was good, though very expensive.

review_preview: Flamenco show = Outstanding!Dinner = Horrible!The show should not be missed. The dinner should be avoided. Watch the show with a drink, skip the dinner. The show was fantastic. The performers were exceptionally talented and truly put great effort and emotion into the...
review_full: Flamenco show = Outstanding! Dinner = Horrible! The show should not be missed. The dinner should be avoided. Watch the show with a drink, skip the dinner.  The show was fantastic. The performers were exceptionally talented and truly put great effort and emotion into the experience.  The dinner was horrible and over priced. The venue is extremely crowded with the tables next to each other. Food orders are taken just before the show. Despite being told that we would eat before the performance, as soon as the lights go off the the performance begins and the meals are served. Thus you must eat in darkness while trying to watch the show. I had to use the light on my cell phone to try to see the food. As for the food, it was served cold, undercooked and uneatable. Since it was dark, the servers could not be attentive. Dinning was expensive, and extremely unpleasant. I recommend dinning at a restaurant before or after the show where you can see and eat the food.

review_full: The flamenco show is great. Even though very traditional. The view of the stage seems to be ok from most tables. The food was ok. Not great but what is to be expected from a tourist restaurant. We just felt that the price for the menus is way too expensive compared with the price level at other good restaurants in Madrid. Service was poor at best, even though everybody spoke english.
